result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan K. Murray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Def to the Court - request for removal of "detainer" in these cases

Clerk has researched this matter in her records. No "detainer" noted in either record. 5/18/17 - clerk responds to def with this information.
from Wisconsin State Public Defender for certified copies of Criminal Complaint and JOC
Sentencing Hearing held this 12th day of June 2015

3 cases called together (14CF95, 14CF96,14CF97). Defendant Ryan K. Murray in custody and in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. has no additional comments or additions to PSI. DA states recommendations for sentencing. 14CF95-6 yrs init conf., 4 yrs ext sup., consecutive to current sentence, 14CF96- 6 yrs init conf., 4 yrs ext sup, concurrent to 14CF95 but consecutive to current sentence, 14CF97-3 yrs probation, consecutive. Comment by Atty M, requests court to follow recommendation of PSI but concurrent. Character statements given by parties. Def addresses the Court. 

Sentencing:    14CF95: - 4 yrs init conf, 5 yrs ext sup. Sentences concurrent to time being served now and concurrent to each other. Conditions of ext sup: comply with AODA treatment programming as deemed appropriate by agent, not to drive without being properly licensed and approval of agent, maintain absolute sobriety, random UA samples, report any prescribed mediation to agent within 48 hrs and coordinate with agent to establish a designated doctor that prescribes medications, no contact with victims unless approved by agent and victims, pay all court ordered obligations and supervision fees and other conditions the DOC may impose, submission of a DNA sample if not previously obtained, payment of court obligations.
                         14CF96: - 4 yrs init conf, 5 yrs ext sup. Sentences concurrent to time being served now and concurrent to each other.
                         14CF97: - 1 yr probation consecutive to sentences in 14CF95 & 14CF96


firearm/voting admonishments given.
request from Atty. McDougal to reschedule the May 22nd sentencing; no objection from the DA
1 doc provided for 3 cases - original stored in 14CF95

14CF95-99, plea hearings, with appearances as follows:  Defendant Ryan K. Murray in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

In the 14CF95, 96, and 97 cases, State moves to delete the repeater allegation; asks Court for PSI with parties free to argue on terms of sentencing.  In 14CF98 and 99, State moves to dismiss/read in; State also moves for deletion of the repeater enhancers in those to-be read-in cases.  Atty. McDougal states the Defense will ask for sentencing date that is as soon as possible; notes def is already in the prison system.

Def pleads guilty to the single felony counts in 14CF95, 14CF96 and 14CF97.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered.  14CF98 and 14CF99 have been dismissed/read-in for the purposes of sentencing.  

Sentencing set for May 22nd at 9 - 2 hours.  PSI due May 1.
"Repeater" modification deleted on the record at request of the DA.

14CF95, 14CF96, 14CF97, 14CF98, and 14CF99, status in all.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Ryan K. Murray. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan K. Murray appeared by video means from Fox Lake Correctional.  DA Harper states that the parties are moving to resolution; asks for plea date in near future; states that the parties will be asking for PSI and the ability to argue the sentence.  Court sets for March 6 at 2 p.m.

Def's appearance will be needed as this will be for plea hearing.  DA's office to prepare the writ; sheriff's dept to transport.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

No contact with named victims in the complaints, AND no contact with C or LF, DM, P or RS, K or DS.  Defendant to submit to booking/printing at the Richland County Sheriffs Department yet today (1/28/15).

Defendant Ryan K. Murray in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:

14CF95, 14CF96, 14CF97, 14CF98, 14CF99/initial.  DA asks for $10000 signature bond in each case; notes def is presently in the prison system and will be for the next two years.  DA notes that she received a speedy dispo request from the def on Monday - request wasn't signed and wasn't received by the clerk.  Atty. M states she was made aware of the request when it was forwarded to her by DA Harper.  Atty. M states that def made the request not understanding what it was for; thought that having pending cases affected his ability to be released.  

Def waives formal reading of the complaints in all five cases.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  In some of these cases, def has been charged as a repeater with that as well as the party-to-the-crime enhancers stated.

At this point, def enters NG plea to the misdemeanor count in 14CF98.  DA notes that the single count in 14CF98 is a misdemeanor; case was filed as a felony due to DA's office error.  DA states that, rather than having the error corrected at this point, she'd ask that the matter remain as listed; may resolve when the others matters resolve.

Atty. M states that def will waive his right to prelim in the four felony cases; requests arraignment in those matters and status in 14CF98 which is actually a misdemeanor.  Feb. 25 at 1:30.

DA requests 10k signature bond with no contact conditions as stated on the record.  Def to be booked on all of these cases.

Atty. M asks for Court's colloquy with Def that the request he made was not a speedy trial demand.  Court conducts a speedy trial colloquy with def.  Def states he filed his request after the prison system came to him and stated that he could be moved to a min-security facility with treatment; that's why he send the paperwork; he did it before he'd talked with his attorney; didn't know it was going to interfere; states parole board said they'd see him in May; possibility for treatment might not come up in another six months to a year.  Def states he's not in min-security right now because of these open charges; felt pressured at the time he made the requests to make them for the reasons he has stated.  Atty. M states def was only doing what was recommended by the records dept to expedite way to treatment facility.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment
